title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 330-1.1 - Purpose and scope
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 330-1.1 - Purpose and scope

State Regulations
(a) The people's
right to know the process of government decisionmaking and the documents and
statistics leading to determinations is basic to our society. The public shall
be granted access to all records which are not specifically exempt from
disclosure by the Freedom of Information Law. (b) This Part provides information concerning
the procedures by which records may be obtained. (c) Records shall be made available to the
public in accordance with the Freedom of Information Law. (d) Any conflicts among laws governing public
access to records shall be construed in favor of the widest possible
availability of public records. (e) Nothing in this Part shall be construed to require the Office of General

Services to prepare any record not possessed or maintained by such entity, except the records specified in subdivision 3 of section 87 of the Public

Officer's Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
330-1.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
